Review: this movie will not earn as much money as it did if it were not AT LEAST excellent.

Author: Felipe007
Review: Seven years later, much people still remember Titanic, the biggest success of ticket office in all the planet. This if must to the enormous talent of the director James Cameron, responsible for the successes the Terminator 1 and 2, Aliens 2 and True Lies. Titanic was its more ambitious project, congregating two actors who would be known currently: Leonardo Di Caprio that were in ascension at the time and Kate Winslet incarnating two young that lived a forbidden love inside it more luxurious ship that finished sinking in the dawn it day 14 of April of 1912. Leonardo Di Caprio is Jack Dawson, a young adventurer who finishes earning in a game to poker a ticket for a trip in the luxurious ship, is clearly that it is in the same ship that Jack will know the young saddened Rose De Witt Bukater (Kate Winslet) that it is promised for the ambitious Cal Hockley (Billy Zane) but in a crisis of desperation, Rose it tries to play itself of the ship and finishes being saved for Jack that is seen by the mother of the young one as a young adventurer who would confuse its plans and would have outside to be a letter play of baralho. Rose and Jack need to face all the obstacles to survive to the shipwreck and for its forbidden love. Titanic finished winning Eleven Oscars equaling to the fact classic it epic Ben-Hur with Charlton Heston interpreting the Jew Judah Ben-Hur. The best film of all is not considered the times therefore exists great classics of the cinema as CasaBlanca, Kane Citizen, Singing In Rain, among others, Titanic valley the penalty only for diversion nothing more moreover. *** of *****

Author: proba_2
Review: **POSSIBLE SPOILERS** "Titanic" is one of the most beautifully made films of all times.  I am not usually emotional when it comes to movies, but to be honest, I found myself crying my eyeballs out when I first watched "Titanic." It is unquestionably a masterpiece. Every single part of that movie elegantly coheres with the rest of it.  The love story, occurring during such tragic event as the sinking of titanic, truly reveals the power of pure love and the risks one is willing to take in order to save it. The acting was great.  Kate Winslet is quite a dramatic actress and after this movie, she became one of my favorites.  Personally, I am not a big fan of DiCaprio, but I don't think he made this film worse in any way.

Author: davergod
Review: It's hard to add a lot to what over a thousand people have said before, so I'll keep the comments short.  This is a fantastic movie.  The effort that James Cameron put into filming the sinking ship is mind-boggling.  And it works.  Well worth seeing.  A love story, an action/adventure disaster movie, and a historical epic set on the high seas (accurate down to the smallest detail)--- all in one.

Author: GirlinParadise21
Review: Terminator and Aliens are different from Titanic in so many ways. First of all, Terminator is, well, in simple terms, bad. Not that the movie was bad, it was just... bad. Titanic was a remarkable love story which you people obviously don't understand. Second, Terminator and Aliens are Sci-fi, and Titanic is, well, no. If you want humor, just watch the whole film in rewind.

Author: adelmastrosmith
Review: This is a beautiful sad movie.  People often say that it is cheesy and corny but I think that is is beautiful and moving.  The acting is quite good, at least on Kate Winslet's part and most supporting actors.  Leonardo DiCaprio's performance is not exactly to be applauded, unlike his performances in Romeo and Juliet and Marvin's Room.  But he's not terrible. Overall this is a fabulous movie that I watch at least once a month whenever I want to cry and imagine I could possibly fall in love someday.

Author: ashleycollman
Review: Titanic is by far one of the greatest movies ever made. To the outside person it may seem like a fictional tale of love during a horrible event in history, it has much more depth. Titanic is a movie about time and greatness. Titanics maiden voyage would also be its last. Titanic, being the biggest ship of its time, was something great to marvel at. It only lasted a short time. Jack and Rose's love was quite similair. Jacks new presence in her life changed who she was forever. He might have been the love of her life, and they were only together for a few days. The importance of the story is that you need to make every moment last, or you could let something great slip by. Ex: Jack could have forfeited in his game of Poker( with the stakes so high.) and would have lost the chance of a lifetime. Rose could have never talked to Jack again and would have gone on wishing she were dead everyday after. LIfe is to precious to let go , make it count!

Author: Roger_rabbit2008

Review: Personally I loved the movie. It told tons of true facts.. like how there wasn't enough lifeboats for all the people .... Then there Happened to be romance which I 'm sure happened back in 1912.. If I was there I would never have left the man I loved I would have done what Rose did( only a little sooner) and stayed with him.

Author: escapoholic
Review_Title: You wouldn't hate it so much if you didn't like it in spite of yourself
Review: My son was born the year this was made, and he's had a life-long interest in the Titanic; as a result, I've seen the '53 and '58 movies as well as this one several times.

Author: Music_Goddess
Review_Title: Greatest Love Story of All Time
Review: I love this movie, from the amazing sets and costumes, to the epic adventure of Jack and Rose as they battle for survival on the Titanic. The music done by James Horner gives me chills every time I hear it and I am always listening to the soundtrack. I love how he captures the essence of the joy at the beginning of the movie when it is first leaving from Southhampton, through the love story of Jack and Rose to the heart-wrenching tragic ending of the RMS Titanic. The casting is superb Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet are two of my favorite actors and have the most incredible chemistry, I really believed that they were in love. The story is amazing and I love how everything that does not happen between Jack and Rose is true, watching the extra features on the bonus DVD I saw the incredible resemblance between the actors and the real people who were on the Titanic, such as Molly Brown and the Captain. I cry for DAYS after watching this movie because it seems so real. The way that James Cameron captures the story of the Titanic through love, passion and tragedy is outstanding I really enjoy watching this movie but also I feel deeply for the people who lost their lives on that tragic day of April 15th 1912. If anything this movie should come back to theaters for the 100th anniversary of the sinking of the Titanic, I as a fan would be thrilled.

Author: Anna_Greece
Review: The best movie i have ever seen. It's my biggest love since 1997. I don't believe that some other movie will make me love it so much until i'll die !!!! I have the original movie on every type like VHS, DVD, DVD Collectors Edition, Blu-ray & 3D, Xvid. The soundtrack is perfect too.

Author: danninn
Review: James Cameron's Titanic is one of the best movies I've ever seen. The cost-of this movie was 285 Millin$! And a 1,8 Billion $ at the box office. Russell Carpenter's cinematography, Conrad Buff's, Richard Harris' and Cameron's editing, Cameron's direction, Peter Lamont's set design, Deborah L. Scott's costumes, Digital Domain's Visual Effects and James Horner's SCORE! Amazing! As the title reveres to the story takes place in the grandest ship of it's time; TITANIC. An American boy, Jack Dawson (Leonardo DiCaprio) and his friend Fabrizio win a ticket, in a poker, to go to America with Titanic. Shortly after the launch Jack sees Rose DeWittBukater (Kate Winslet), a spoiled, girl, engaged to Caledon Hockley (Billy Zane), a man of big wealth. Later that night Jack saves Rose's life. The rest is history...

Author: nawazmd-81221
Review: If you haven't watched TITANIC then you shouldn't watch movies at all. It has an emotion that is unmatched. A movie of millennium. I love TITANIC more than any other movie, it will remain to be my favourite forever.

Author: The_Silent_Heroes
Review: The long-awaited advent of the most expensive movie ever made, the reportedly $200 million ''Titanic,'' brings history to mind, and not just the legendary seafaring disaster of April 15, 1912. Think back also, exactly 58 years ago today, to the Dec. 19 New York premiere of another grand, transporting love story set against a backdrop of prideful excess, cataclysmic upheaval and character-defining trial by fire.

Author: anothergirl83
Review: It's been almost six years since the release of 'Titanic' and there are still two views on it: love it, hate it. Inevitable, I suppose, with a movie like this. A lot of the complaints go to the script, the romance, Leo DiCaprio. Everyone is entitled to their opinion, of course, and those who hate it will probably never love it. I do, however, think that the success of the movie is justified. Bashed before it was even released, it didn't "sink" like many predicted it would. The main reason for this may be the fact that this movie brought to life the actual tragedy of what happened to the ship in 1912. It isn't so much about how "shallow" the script was - the ship and it's passengers were brought to life. The passengers were shown as real human beings, like you and me, who had hopes and aspirations. Tragedies usually get type-cast for the number of victims, and we tend to forget that each of those numbers was a person with a story. The movie placed the viewers on that ship and made us feel with the people aboard. The fictional story of Jack and Rose - which, IMHO, is a moving love story - gave us an emotional focal point, and made the tragedy much more personal. You may hate the film, and it's actors (although, they are all perfectly cast and superb actors, not just in 'Titanic'), but the tragedy of what happened, and the idea that life is there to be lived, no matter what fate may have in store for you, is what makes this movie special and appealing.

Author: teababy-67170
Review_Title: The Greatest Movie Of All Time!!!!!
Review: Titanic, directed by James Cameron, earned a whopping 11 Oscars in one night. Those Oscars include; Best Picture, Best Director, Best Cinematography, Best Art Direction-Set Decoration, Best Costume Design, Best Film Editing, Best Effects, Sound Effects Editing, Best Effects, Visual Effects, Best Music, Original Song, For the song "My Heart Will Go On", performed by Céline Dion, Best Music, Original Dramatic Score. It also earned 7.7 stars on IMDb public voters. In my option Titanic was one of the greatest movies of all time, because of the great acting scenes and the emotion bond connection I am able to make with the characters, and with Leonardo DiCaprio staring in the film was just the icing on the cake.

Author: macpheonix
Review: This movie is the most successful movie (in terms of box-office numbers) of all time, because of the "Kool-Aid factor". People got so wrapped up in the sweeping trend of thought that the movie was great, that most of them were not judging it objectively. In reality, it isn't a BAD movie, it's just not great. The special effects and Kate Winslet look great in the movie. While we're on the subject, Leonardo DiCapprio is someone else who is overrated. He's....OK. He was very good in "The Basketball Diaries", and he was decent in "The Aviator" and "The Beach". I was NOT impressed, however (unlike most people), with his performance in "What's Eating Gilbert Grape". He didn't play a mentally handicapped kid -- he played a "retard". What I mean by that is, that he was doing more of a caricature or stereotype of a mentally handicapped person. Well, enough about that for now....

Review: this one is one of the best romantic movies ever released up to date. the cast of the movie was great and the story line was awesome..!! the way they have carried on the story just to make the viewers to be attentive throughout..!!! the work of the Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet was something watchfull. i loved the movie it is still one of my all time favourite a must watch movie for every one who love a romantic movie it is one of the finest with great story line and awesome production and direction skills shown by the directer and the producer.. Bernardo Bertolucci directed it with such a great class and experience it must be admired that was just awesome great movie every one should watch this

Author: Lil Alex
Review_Title: Why do people hate this film?
Review: I think people hate this film because they are letting the hype about the film interfere with how they see the film.  Don't judge a film based on outside influences.  Don't hate it because Cameron is an egomaniac.  Don't hate it because 14 year old girls went 20 times just to see Leo.  Don't hate it because they played that song 10 times a day for a year.  Hate it because you hate the movie itself, what was on the screen and that alone. If you but all the hype aside I think you will see a truly great film.  A film that succeeds on many levels.  Special effects, acting, music, action, humor, historical, moral, philosophical.  Did I miss one? I'll admit I love Cameron films.  I don't however typically like "chick" flicks, and this is partially a chick flick.  But it is also an "action" flick. Does it go on to long.  I say about 5 minutes.  I hate the part with the stupid kid screaming alone in the hallway.  Other than that it's perfect in just about every way.  I graduated from film school and nothing I saw there came close to this film.

Author: ariadnabeatriz17
Review: "Titanic" is a film based in the terrible history of R.M.S. TITANIC, romantic and very very dramatic.

Author: John Doe-16
Review: Some people will look for anything to criticize this movie.  I recall one user comment complaining that the ship didn't have any bow waves.  Oh dear God no!  I usually can't stand the tedium of romance movies, but I found this one to be very entertaining, although I think DiCaprio should try a push-up one of these days.  By the way, great career ditching "American Psycho" for "The Beach".  Anyway, some criticism I'd like to offer is Billy Zane's character.  I realize that he is the predesignated bad guy, but does his character really have to be so unoriginal?  I'd like to have seen him as a real person and not equipped with the default personality for villains. Of course, I guess all the other main characters are pretty much just as unoriginal, but I enjoyed the movie anyway.  I recollect releasing an especially malignant laugh upon the weeping audience as I witnessed Leonardo's frozen, pretty little face dwindling down into the black abyss of the Atlantic Ocean.  I don't understand the point of keeping a priceless diamond for about eighty years just to plop into the ocean.  Maybe her senility clouded the fact that its value is beyond that of money, or maybe she just an IDIOT!  Uh-oh, it appears that now I am nitpicking.  I guess I'm just a hypocrite.

Author: vlf1
Review: Now that the hype is over, this movie shows itself as the ho-hum affair it is.  The special effects can't make up for ordinary script and acting.  It may have been a tour de force to create it, but the overall result is a run of the mill Hollywood movie.

Author: robnrich05
Review: TITANIC in it's time was the Ship of Dreams. She was big, beautiful, and luxurious. One scene is where there is an Officer of the ship who salutes his comrade, and shoots himself in the head. That never happened. However, the order that was given women and children first was accurate for sure.

Author: OttersFilms
Review: I saw the film after its successful Oscars haul and found it a major let down. It seems that the more effort that film makers put into special effects, the less attention they give to the script.

Author: Luke-18
Review_Title: it was the best of films, it was the worst of films...
Review: I have heard people herald this as the work of genius.  I have heard just as many people declare it the work of the anti-christ.  I, myself, spent some time (most intensely, I might add, around the time of the Academy Awards) in the latter group.  Now that I have had time to step back and organize my opinions objectively, I can no longer claim that "Titanic" is the worst movie in history.  Though there are a number of places where the dialogue is unforgivable, and the performances of DiCaprio and Zane are downright laughable, I must admit that the cinematography is superb, as are the directing and the special effects.  I find it horrible that the lives of some 1100 people or so are trivialized by focusing on the clichéd love story between the two lead.  I can't, however, in clear conscience, continue to condemn this movie as I have in the past.  Glistening amongst the arrid wasteland of poor dialogue are gems of writing (though most of them are factual occurrences that not even James Cameron would dare claim to be his ideas) and visual communication.  "Titanic" is a film of superlative nature, both the best and the worst.  No movie in history has been so polarized as this.  There is no room for mediocrity in this self-indulgent epic.

Author: Frick-2
Review: Nothing on earth could come between them. Exactly. Excellent film. I gave it **** 1/2 out of ***** stars because there were many "goofs", that simply could've been prevented. Leonardo DiCaprio isn't the best actor, but he definitely gave it his best in this film. I saw it 4 times, and I'm still not tired of it! I hope they have another Titanic where Jack lives.

Moment gone - killed by stating the obvious.

Author: funkmunk69
Review: Love this movie and the love story involved between jack and rose. though it takes a while to get the movie started when jack and rose finally meet the movie keeps getting better and better

Author: weezer_2005
Review: Many people think this movie is average, largely because it has been at the front of hundreds of jokes about the "pathetic" romance in it. Personally i totally disagree, the romance is how it should be. If you are going to watch a romantic film, you need it to move you and make you fall in love with the characters. In this film, you don't connect so much with the characters but you can see how the characters connect with each other which is something else entirely. If these people who were insulting this movie were to sit down in a theatre and watch it alone, i am sure that they would love it, hell these people were the ones that were raving about it in 97! The special effects are like nothing seen before on film. They are amazing, for the time the special effects were very ahead of its time and even now to this day, the effects are just as good. To be honest, the effects look far more realistic than the effects in movies like Die Another Day. You cannot spot any CG in the entire movie except for the iceberg which is obviously CG.

Author: alaskatwo2003
Review: In an entire lifetime their will never be another film to equal "TITANIC".I saw it 14 times and never missed a frame.It was a masterpiece of hard work and the results showed.I traveled to Mexico to see where the film was shot,and walk on the same ground those wonderful performers walked on.I thought about the long hours of shooting and the hard work all the actors put in.Leo and Kate were unbelievable,should have won Oscars.Their performances were very real,and the scene where Kate is going for help and the light flicker on and off was one of the best I have ever seen in my lifetime.I thought about what I would do in that terrible situation.Wherever their lives may go in life this film will be the triple crown in their lives. I hope someday the entire film is released on DVD,every scene that had to be cut for time. A masterpiece that I will never forget as long as I live. Simply the Very Best film ever made,in my mind.On Oscar night when Titanic won 11 awards I felt great,but it should have won 13.Well we don't always get everything we want in life,do we.I know that their were millions of souls on earth that felt the same way I did and still do about this "Masterpiece" called "TITANIC". In my eyes the film will live forever,for many generations to come.I hope someday they will re-release the film so I can marvel at the awesome scope on the big screen.Maybe in 2007 on its 10th annv. I'm hoping it happens.

Author: mulder-26
Review: I do not understand how so many people can dislike this film. It is one of the most amazing cinematic achievements to come out in years. I also do not understand how people who go to see films like this only see its faults (so-called bad acting, script, etc.), and not the good qualities it possesses, of which there are many.

Author: bidie_the_boofhead_is
Review_Title: 84 years after the Titanic sank a survivor tells her story about the "Ship of Dreams" and how a young man saved her in every way that a person can be saved.
Review: Titanic is the best movie that I have seen to this day. I was nine when I first saw the movie and the only reason why my mum let me watch it was because I had done so much research and written my own stories based on the Titanic. The cinematography did the ship justice and the movie made the Titanic look just as good as the luxurious liner.

Author: peter-898
Review: What a travesty of justice. Any movie that this one was up against in '97 was better. The real crime was L.A. Confidential not winning. This movie sucks. If anything it showed that Mr. Cameron could organize lots of people. Nothing more than that. Predictable. Bad acting. Boring story line. Wasted dollars. Even Good Will Hunting was better than this piece of trite filth. "The Full Monty" was better than "Titanic." I would challenge anyone to dispute this fact, I can easily dispel any non beleivers. I haven't watched the Oscars since this terrible evil happened. I mean if you want to watch a good ocean going movie try "Master and Comander."

Author: HaffPint
Review_Title: Take away the special effects, and it's still a 10...
Review: If you take away the special effects from this movie, you still have the greatest film ever made.  Usually, with big budget eyeball movies, nothing much is top notch outside of the special effects.  But personally, from the moment that Rose Dewitt-Bukater steps out of her car, she captivates all eyes in the audience.  She is the movie star of her time, and she was robbed of the Best Actress Oscar.  All of the other actors around her shine also, including Billy Zane, who is an amazing villain, Frances Fisher, Leonardo DiCaprio, and all of the other wonderful actors in this film, give the greatest performances for a film full of love, passion, and heartache.  This is the only flawless film I have ever seen.  I was unable to move from my seat after this journey, and that doesn't happen often. Titanic is a 10, Kate Winslet is a star, and the movie has won my heart.

Author: 6thJuniorsASTEPS
Review: I have seen this film like 10 times,and every time y watch  I enjoy it like the first one.Before the first one, I thought "Oh no, it`s too long,this will be a slow film".And now I know how wrong I was. The story was pretty good,because the director mingles the love story with the disaster of the boat.And it`s so captiviting that you don`t realize that 3 hours have passed. And the two main stars are awesome.Kate winslet act as the rich girl that lives unhappy because she has depply fall in love with Jack Dawson ,that it`s Leonardo Dicaprio, but she has to get married with a horrible rich man.The setting and the costume are also great.The only thing that I don`t agree with are the special effects,they are like cartoons ones. On the whole I think it`s a wonderful film,That will make you cry.And I`m sure you will never get bored,so in my view,it`s well worth seeing

Author: randjaky
Review_Title: Dreadful when she ship isn't sinking
Review: Robert Altman said this was the worst movie he'd ever seen. The ship doesn't start to founder until well over an hour filled with some of the most turgid melodrama and dreadful dialog ever committed to film. At the point when Jack overhears that the ship is likely to sink with great loss of life, he says to Rose, "This is bad." The director even stages a gun battle in the middle of the sinking, as if one of the most dramatic events in the 20th century needed another cliffhanger. My favorite line in the film: Jack and Rose are hanging onto the bow of the ship as it begins its slide into the ocean and she says, "Jack, this is where we first met!" I wonder if there is a Hallmark card for that.

Author: cdth89413
Review: I just came back from watching it in IMAX 3D. The movie stands classic and timeless. If anything, with some revealing mistakes digitally modified (eg. The visible strings that pulled the cups off the fireplace where Mr. Andrews stood during the sinking; They re- colored the upper half of the funnel that fell upon those poor people; The metal reel that crinkled when it was hit by a man; The famous milky way shot where Rose was lying on the wooden plank) and the image enhanced, it looked better than ever and felt extremely intimate because of the "subtle" 3D conversion. The colors simply looked beautiful and bright and the change between blue and red intensified the drama and viewers' emotions very effectively. The "I'm flying" scene at the bow worked as if you were actually there, with seawater going by underneath your vision. The most wonderful thing was that as the movie went, the 3D effect gradually became "invisible" because all viewers got so deeply drawn into the film and they just got used to it. You will find yourself laughing at the "cheesy" jokes in the cheery and glamorous first half of the movie and quieting down and grieving for the tragic loss of so many lives as the ship sinks with the whole audience.

Author: green_t_20
Review: this movie makes us all realize that things aren't what they may seem.the titanic wasn't suppose to sink, but it did.and it changed history.it also shows us that your choices affect other people. maybe not this drastically but they do affect people.the captain said full speed ahead when he knew there were ice burgs. and Jack fighting for Rose!this movie can show us that if u love somebody to keep fighting for them and don't let someone else take them away. there may be many obstacles but u can get around them. Jack told us to take life a "deal" at a time.and we all should take what life throws at you.this movie changes lives in more then one way: love, living, and choices!

Author: rparker-2
Review: I don't usually cast a vote for movies, but this movie was incredibly compelling.  It has my vote for best direction and screenplay.  Despite comments to the contrary, I thought the two main protagonists, did a FANTASTIC job.  This was a very well made, correographed, and well written (re-write) of a movie.  It was incredible in every detail.  I thoroughly enjoyed every minute, and this will be in my DVD library forever.  I only wish they made Gold Standard DVD, this would be a classic masterpiece, of which I would proudly display (and watch) to serve as a reminder just how well done this movie is.  I didn't realize the true story of what happened, until the events unfolded in this outstanding film.  This movie gets my vote as perhaps my favorite movie of all time.  Certainly, you cannot deny, its impact on the entire world, because as of the date of this comment, its the best selling movie.. by at least double.. of ALL time.  I would say, its the best overall movie, even though I myself prefer Sci-Fi/Fantasy movies.  This movie moved me, and I, even being a man, am not afraid to say , stirred feelings I never knew I had.  I was angry, upset, frightened, and shocked all at the same time.  This movie is perhaps the only movie to date , in my mind, worth the title: Number 1.

Author: Den-13
Review_Title: The best movie of all time!
Review: This was James Cameron's best work yet! I've said before 'That was the best movie I've ever seen'. But when I saw Titanic, it definitely was the best. I even own a copy of Titanic, I doubt the new Staw Wars movie will even come close.

Author: becks-17
Review: OK, I have a confession:I was one of the fourteen year old girls who sobbed through many a viewing of Titanic,paid to see it at the cinema more than once, bought the video the day it came out and spent many evenings re-watching it. I read books about the film and about the actual history of the ship. In short I became obsessed. Sadly, or rather thankfully, I was not alone. Looking back now at the ripe old age of twenty I cringe at the memory of those days and although having only watched the film once in the last four years (truly) I still regard the film with affection. Of course, now I have distance to actually pick holes in it. Yes, the writing in places is slightly glossy, shall we say. The story is rather predictable and the whole rich girl falls in love with poor cheeky chappy has been done a few times before. The run up to the sinking takes one and a half hours and the sinking takes that time again. Some would say it moves too slowly and for the action loving film-goers out there I certainly take their point. The film does tend to take stereotypes to the max (for instance the treatment of third-class passengers and the snobbery of first-class). This said, I was not alive in 1912 and perhaps this is a completely justified representation of how things were! To me, (though I would never have admitted this six years ago) the iceberg never looked very real-again, having not seen many big icebergs I may be mistaken. However the film has something very rare. It has a certain kind of magic, a soul to it that makes fourteen year old girls sob into their pillows after watching it-I never actually did that...it was just an example.. The love story, although predictable and almost sickening in places has an innocent quality, awakening in the audience memories of their first loves and the naughty glances across rooms and boat decks. True, this is not Leonardo DiCaprio's finest hour (anyone who has seen him in "What's Eating Gilbert Grape?" will testify) but then the story does not demand an awesome display of acting qualities-just that he be life-loving with a boyish charm (and be able to hang onto the side of a ship for long stretches of time). Kate Winslet plays the sheltered high-society darling to perfection and the rest of the cast slot into place. Of course, the real lead character is the 'Ship of Dreams' herself and the art department certainly came up trumps there, as did the special effects team, turning the cinema/TV screen into a porthole peering into the past-except for the aforementioned iceberg (but then that always posed a problem)-the whole film makes 1912 come alive for a modern-day audience.

Author: your_not_me_im_me
Review: This film is pants, three painstaking, mush-filled hours of some of the poorest film making I've ever witnessed.  And the sad thing is, this is James cameron.  He made Aliens!  He made Terminator and Terminator 2! These films are classics, undoubted classics but Titanic.....it smells.  Bad. Dont watch it, ever.  And if you do see someone actively wanting to view this film, shoot them.  It's for their own good.  End of.

Author: DiCaprioAngel
Review_Title: A movie that touched my heart, gets a rate of ten, because this is my number one favorite movie of all time...
Review: I give this movie a rate of ten, because this movie was, and is, the best movie I have ever seen in my life. This movie is the top of my top ten list of favorite movies, and I know that no other movie would ever replace it. This movie is a love story, and that's one of the things I love about this movie. It shows how love could be found, then lost, but also last forever. It also shows how keeping a promise could make your life worthwhile, and how making each day of your life count, as if that day was your last. This movie shows how strong a love can be, even if one lover had perished. This movie shows, that no matter what happens, or no matter how hopeless, their love will last for an eternity, and it did. This movie has taught me how to make each day count, and that someday, I might find my own Jack Dawson. But most of all, this movie has taught me, that love could happen in a matter of days, and last for an eternity. This movie has always been my favorite, and always will be...I strongly recommend this movie, if you haven't seen it, but then again, it's impossible that no one has seen it, because I'm sure that everyone has at least seen it once...this movie has touched my heart, as well as the hearts of many others...I just hope that this movie has touched yours too.

Review_Title: TITANIC is a wonderfully moving story, and has effected me more than any film ever has.

Each time I see the film it is as if I am really aboard the great ship, and I feel what the characters feel.  James Cameron has done a magnificent job of expressing the emotions and feeling of each character, and it never ceases to touch my soul.

Author: Juliet-7
Review: I'll start by saying I loved this film.  I thought it was beautifully done and I loved Leo and Kate (everyone should go check out Heavenly Creatures, by the way).  But everyone has heard why this is such a good movie.  I do want to say that if it weren't such a popular movie, it probably wouldn't be criticized nearly as much.  People want to hate what is popular and they'll find ways to scrutinize this movie to death.  One of the main problems seems to be that Cameron brought a fictional story to the Titanic rather than one of the real ones.  Yes, but then you can say that about most war movies- or books, for that matter!  I don't think the real people of the Titanic were ignored at all.  We got to see the different classes and ways of life in a combined story.  Or people say he didn't spend enough time on Molly Brown's character- but how long do you all want this movie to be?!  If I was going to complain about anything, I might mention that the second class seems to have disappeared from the ship.  But again, the movie is already over three hours long. I know that feeling when you seem to be the only one to know about something or someone and then it becomes "household".  I've always been incredibly interested in Titanic and knew all those random but real stories that all 9th grade girls now know.  I have loved Kate Winslet since Heavenly Creatures was made and Leo since I saw him in Basketball Diaries.  Remember when no-one knew who either of them were?  But this really doesn't matter. My point is let something be popular without feeling abliged to stand out and hate it.  Just because it is mainstream doesn't mean it is bad.

Author: cloudnsquallffs
Review_Title: This may be the first three hour movie I've ever seen, but it seemed like ten minutes to me.
Review: I may be a guy, but this movie really hit me in the heart. I'm not the kind of guy that likes to pick a fight like every other man does, I got emotions, too. The first time I saw "Titanic", it seemed to pass by really fast. Sure, I admit, it's a long movie, but it felt like a ten minute cartoon. Before I knew it, it was over. What I'm trying to say is: Don't pass this one up. If you look into this movie very closely, you will see what I mean. I'm surprised "Titanic" isn't in the top 250 movies.

Author: maxrothman85
Review: WARNING: SPOILERS INCLUDED! Titanic will always remain one of my favorite films. I have seen this movie so many times you cannot even imagine. Most people hate this movie now and make fun of it for some odd reason but I don't care. Everything in this film is perfect and flawless. The cinematography, art direction, costume design, visual effects, performances, music, you name it. Once we go back to the time Titanic was to set sail for the first time, magic takes over the film. But of course we cannot deny that the ship is doomed in 4 days and 1500 people are going to die. The sinking of the ship and the death of the passengers is not easy to watch but it is part of what made the film a great epic. The final scene where Rose's spirit goes back to Titanic on the ocean floor and joining Jack and other spirits is powerful and moving. The love between Jack and Rose none of us can ignore and feel. Believe it or not Rose's fiancé, Cal, also did love Rose but not the way Jack did and I could see why rage took over him and tried to kill them with a gun.

Author: sally-100
Review: The night I saw this movie I thought, "You know, this was a pretty good movie."  Then all the mass hysteria, Leonardo- worshipping scariness began. I thought that there must have been something incredible that I had missed- How could everyone else love it this much?   Then I realized that for the most part, people are sheep and will like whatever they are told to like. Yes- it was an enjoyable movie.  The effects were good (Not Star Wars good, but good) and I like Kate Winslet (as long as she remains fully clothed) but the story was sorely lacking.  My thirteen-year old sister could have come up with that plot.  In addition, it was approximately 17 hours long.  I think that if we all step back and view this phenomenon reasonably, we will see this phenomenon for what it really is--a movie that was entertaining once, but nothing big in the grand scheme of moviedom (or life, for that matter).

Review_Title: What a waste of film, it only got good when it sank
Review: I expected to see a masterpiece, given the hype related to this film.  But all I got was 2 and half hours of cliche ridden dialogue and the most unconvincing romance between two leads since Bill and Hillary.  Admittedly the special effects were good as was the period recreation eg costuming, set design.  But overall the film failed on many levels.

Author: Ticket
Review: First of all I want to clear something up. Someone made a comment about ceramic plates don't float on water....that's right but not on salt water. A lot of things that don't float on plain water floats on salt water. Simple things like that were carefully thought out during the making of this film, to see what it would have been like inside a sinking ship. Well about the film. It had excellent special effects except for that overhead shot of the ship when one of the crew men went up to the captain. It almost got me fooled, but the high swinging arms gave it away(CGI). Overall this film made a LOT of money and a lot of people came to see it. That I guess is what's important, and not what critics think, critics like me.

Author: mcc-2
Review: When I first saw this movie a year ago, I was looking foward to an OK movie-nothing special, but you know-what the hell.  The theaters were packed full-all 3 showing the movie, that is.  When the music, and the footage of the ship leaving dock first started, my heart already ached because I knew the ship was the culmination of the world's optimism.  I also knew that it would sink, killing 1500 people.  What a lesson in human arrogance and stupidity.  Though the sinking of the ship was indeed sad, it is the characters that make the story absolutely heart-rending.  The story of Rose and Jack, two star-crossed lovers; Andrews, guilt-ridden that he hasn't built a stronger ship; Unsinkable Molly Brown; a mother who is saddened by what her daughter is forced to do, but ultimately goes along with it; the craven Bruce Ismay; villains Caledon Hockely and valet/henchman Spicer Lovejoy...the list continues. The technical prowess of Cameron cannot be overlooked.  The special effects were astounding, especially when the ship starts sinking and you get the full impact of the size of the ship and the horror the passengers must have felt when they realized that the unsinkable ship was turning into a steel tomb.  The music was perfect.  I can't say any more.  If you haven't seen it, you'll know what I mean when you see it.  And if you have seen it, you already know what I'm talking about.  And at the end...whoo boy.  I didn't have nearly enough Kleenex.  I think my sister was the only dry-eyed one there.  There were times when I couldn't hear over the viewers snuffling.  I saw it again last January, and cried just as much. Well, I finally got the movie a week ago, and I promised myself I wouldn't cry.  DENIED!!  I cried more than the first time-I suppose I already knew what I was in for.  If you haven't seen it at this late date, then by all means-SEE IT! You don't know what you're missing.  Though it did have some rather corny dialogue --"The inertia of my (Rose's) life?" Oh, *please*, I give it 6 of 5 stars.

Author: julieneven
Review: Titanic is a true story about the disaster of the Titanic who sunk in 1912, directed by James Cameron. The movie starts with a guy who is looking for a treasure, a diamond neck less, which would be hidden in the Titanic. When he goes searching, he finds a safe, but only with money and a drawing of a woman, Rose, who's wearing the diamond neck less. She sees this on TV and contacts the man. Then she starts telling her story : Rose took the boat to the U.S with her family and fiancé Caledon. Rose isn't happy and wants to kill herself but Jack is the one who saves her. That's the moment that Rose and Jack meet for the first time. Rose's family forbids her to have contact with Jack, but Rose refuses and falls in love with Jack.

Review: I LOVE the Titanic. It's simply the best movie EVER. I'm a TOTAL Titanic buff, and I just love the way James Cameron portrays the Titanic. I always cry whenever I see it, even though I've seen it probably hundreds of times before. Its a magnificent movie and it was #1 in the box office for 3 months straight. If you haven't seen it, you're missing out on A LOT. A bit of Titanic trivia: In the movie, when Jack draws Rose, the hands are those of James Cameron, the director and drawer of the picture. When Jack mentions ice fishing to Rose, it can't be possible... the reason why is because he mentions a man-made lake in Wisconsin that wasn't built until 1918, after the Titanic sank.

Review: James Cameron should stick to sci-fi - this is a complete mess of a film. Alright, it is accurate in the period detail, but having the English as evil upper class snobs and the Irish as wonderful but poor heroes is just so cliche ridden. (And no, I'm not English but French/Australian). Leonardo Di Caprio cannot act to save his life (Ha Ha) and I felt sorry for Kate Winslet, who showed that she can act in "Heavenly Creatures".  If you want to see an excellent film on the Titanic, watch "A Night to Remember" - it is far superior, better written and much more moving.

Author: The_UndeaD_
Review_Title: Life and Love drown in a cold sea of reality
Review: Titanic the movie is not great because of the love story.The movie takes off from the ordinary movie scene during the last hour of the movie,when the titanic actually sinks.Leo and Kate play their roles duly well.The only flaws in the movie were in the beginning special effects of the birds-eye view of the ship and its passengers walking to and fro.The plot generated interest and kept our virgin minds ready for the climax.Now you cant call the climax of the Titanic a climax.It beats all climaxes both in length of time and the way it hits you.The special effects were flawless.The massive Titanic really sank and all those people really died in front of your eyes.No purgatory,no trial nothing.Just cold merciless death.The part that moved me most was the frozen body of a lady with a dead child.In the end while leaving the hall I remember staring at the sky asking why.

Watch this regardless of what your favourite genres are, watch this if your just a fan of awesome movies. Author: aszahn
Review: Titanic.  It speaks for itself.  The name means huge.  That is what this movie was. Huge.  You could tell that Winslet, DiCaprio, Stuart, Paxton, Zane, and everyone else really loved working.  At times they referred to Cameron as a "tyrant".  I can see why.  Working on a movie that has a budget more than some countries have to spend is pretty difficult.  Cameron squeezed emotion out of monotone Leo and proper Kate.  (Has anyone noticed that in every movie she plays she is wealthy)  For that, we owe Cameron, and the cast, a round of applause.

Author: Carol4
Review: I don't know what all of you people who didn't like Titanic are talking about! I thought Titanic was the greatest movie I have ever seen! I was lucky enough to see it on it's opening day. To tell you the truth I HATED Leo when the movie first came out. After I saw Titanic all that changed. I couldn't help falling in love with him as Jack Dawson. I mean face it he's the kind of guy any girl would want I mean he's sweet, caring, brave, and who wouldn't want a guy who risks their life for yours. I thought the love story was very moving. It's the kind of love story everyone would want. It's my dream love story I would give anything to be loved like that. Who cares about the special effects get away from that and focus on the story of two hearts who go against tremendous odds to be together I mean Rose couldn't stand to be in a lifeboat if it mean being separated from Jack. I thought the script was very well written and the actors did a tremendous job especially Leo and Kate they lit up the screen. Stop comparing Titanic to Star Wars they are two totally different movies I'm a big fan of them both. Star Wars was a action packed sci-fic adventure and Titanic was a story about Jack and Rose who experience the kind of love we all dream about but seldom find.

Review_Title: A dream rather than a movie
Review: An sad movie, I Had Servere headaches because I cried too much. Sorry for my grammar (German mobile Keyboard)... It began as a regular movie, a very happy movie. Fun only. I watched this movie for the First time this year. But the fun would end soon, when I saw that Rose was deeply unhappy with Cal ... and Jack - after saving her from suicide - was unhappy that he would probably never be able to get her. But this would change when a rebellious Rose would begin to overcome her fear and start to give the passionate Jack a Chance.

Author: pmc31-1
Review: Spoilers ahead.

Author: saphire_
Review: I just wanted to say that I have done research on the Titanic, and this move has so much detail! I am so surprised on how much detail was used in this movie. I have NEVER seen a movie that is based on a true story that who made it actually took the time to really get into detail. I am very pleased with that.

Author: sanjev-24589
Review:
When the movie got released, I was 10 years young and being non-english speaker, I didn't understand the dialogues and didn't like it as it had no action scenes as well.
But as I turned 17, I watched it again and was mesmerized, touched and drained with tears. AND THE STORY CONTINUES TILL DATE AND WILL FOREVER......

Author: boyscout-4
Review: It was a great movie, a heart felt perspective on a heart felt tragedy. The movie was awesome.  Very few historically accurate movies can be this good, it's worth all 600 million it has brought in at the box office.

Review: When i first saw this movie i didn't like it, maybe because i was too young to understand it.

Author: cutie_panda12345
Review_Title: You trash it because it sank. Real mature.
Review: The first time I watched this movie... I just got so emotional. I'd always liked the whole idea of the Titanic and I really enjoyed the film. I love the costumes and the set, and I really fell in love with Kate Winslet's acting. Leonardo DiCaprio, too, did a great job, and the special effects seem pretty good for 1997.

Author: m-stoel
Review_Title: A great movie about the Titanic
Review: I liked the movie very much, because Rose and Jack were played very good. The director made very good use of the existing theories about the Titanic, like how it sunk, how everything was, etc... On the end the movie was very exciting, but some parts before were funny and also impressive. This was a movie that made great impact to me compared to other movies. So over all: A great movie, I would recommend it to everyone

Author: Rebekah_Angel_123
Review_Title: Titanic is my favourite movie ever
Review: Titanic is proboly the best movie I have ever seen. It seems so real and is very very moving.The first time i saw it i cried (which i hardly ever do in a movie)Jack and Rose are perfect together and it is very sad at the end when Jack dies. The whole movie taught me a lot. I was very glad i watched it for my first time when i was 11 years old now i am 13 and have watched it 6 times since then. And i never seem to get bored of it it is a one of a kind movie and i can see why it won so many Oscars. I really like the scene were Rose and Jack are at the front of the boat and jack says "do u trust me" then he lifts her up so 'shes flying'.The whole movie i rate 10/10 for obvious reasons.

Author: Jerrika92
Review: I just saw the movie not too long ago from start to finish with my boyfriend. He thought it was really stupid but I loved it. It was beautiful, Especially the true love moments between Rose and Jack. Rose is a sad girl before Jack not really living life, just doing whatever she was told. Engaged to a guy she did not love, well that changed when she met Jack. Rose was unhappy with her life, so she was going to jump into the water, but Jack convinced her of otherwise. From there the movie becomes better and better. The only part that really made me cry, was when the workers wouldn't let the people from 3rd class out. Well there is a mother and her two children and she tells them a story to help them sleep, knowing them would never wake up again. I love the character Rose, for not getting into the boat even when everyone wanted her too, she choose to stay with Jack till the end. Over all this movie is one of a kind and is way worth seeing.

Author: reynald-2
Review: I almost wish this film was not as financially as successful as it was so that some people are not prejudiced by its mainstream appeal for they would miss not only a great movie but an experience.

Author: imdb-701
Review: Forget the multi-billion takings, the ability of the actors, the love theme...

Author: moretti-35843
Review: WARNING SPOILER*******

Author: ching5375
Review: It was a great movie. This film was based on the true story about the unsinkable ship'Titanic'which lies beneath the North Atlantic. Directed by James Cameron and starring by Kate Winslet as Rose Dewitt Bukater and Leonardo Dicaprio as Jack Dawson, this film won eleven academy awards including best picture in 1997. Kate Winslet is a capable actress. She is a young rich girl sailing to the USA to get married to a young rich man who gives her a priceless blue diamond. Her mother is forcing her to get married and she become desperate. She tries to commit suicide but she is saved by Jack Dawson. Jack is a third-class passenger who likes drawing. They get to know each other very well and then they fall in love. This film is the greatest film I have ever seen. I admit I cried when I saw this film. I can't imagine how they tried to struggle in the freezing water and hope someone can save them.

Author: kabrio
Review: I have seen this movie many times and it gets better and better each time. James Cameron did a great work, because he combined the great special effects of the Titanic downfall with the love story between Jake (Leo DiCaprio) and Rose (Kate Winslet).

Author: federicaandretta
Review: This movie reminds me of my teenage times. I was 14 years old when I went to the cinema with my family and some friends the first time. I would have never imagined that one day this film would become one of the greatest masterpieces in the world and that it would have an emotional impact on me. I love Titanic not only for the movie itself but also for the history that lies in it. James Cameron is not just a movie maker but a great poet who talks through his heart to us. He also tells a story in a way never done before. It's not just a love story or a history movie. It's more. It's hard to explain it in words but if one reads the books about the movie one can understand what I mean. I will always thank him for his work. His expeditions made to the relict also impressed me much. But I also want to thank his crew and all the people who worked with him! Also a special thank to all the actors obviously! Titanic was and will always be the ship of dreams to all of us.

Author: blondeatheart330
Review: Titanic is one of the best movies ever made, and that is proved with the record for the most money made at the box office (about 700 million). This extremely long movie stars Leo DiCaprio, who plays Jack, a poor teen with only ten dollars in his pocket, and Kate Winslet, who plays Rose, a spoiled girl who's life has already been planned by her controlling mother and malicious fiancé. Jack and Rose fatefully meet aboard the 'unsinkable' Titanic on its first and last voyage in 1914. Jack saves Rose from her predictable life and teaches her that she's in control of her life, not her fiancé or her mother. Rose and Jack's romance is short-lived, as we all know what happens to the Titanic...

Author: english_rose91
Review: I love this movie 100%. It's got a great storyline, good drama and good casting esp. the lead actor!!!lol. Kate Winslet is a fabulous actress and an inspiration to young girls everywhere with her sensible, enviable figure and i love her as a redhead!! How on earth did she not win an Oscar??? Great movie anyone who hasn't seen it is MAD & i recommend it 100%. Fave scenes: the flying one, the drawing scene, the one where Rose saves Jack by cutting the handcuffs, the bit where she jumps back onto the boat, "This is where we first met!" and the very end scene. Low points: NONE!!! One warning: have a box of tissues ready!!!! 10/10

Author: MannyGirl168
Review: This movie was one of the best movies i have ever seen. Its a tale of love and tragedy. This movie is amazing. I love the story line. Jack and Rose belong together. I love the ending with the part about the heart of the ocean. And people who have seen this know what I'm talking about. Jack has such a good outlook on life its great. The Titanic was a awful mistake. Many people died and seeing what happened on the ship was amazing. I definitely recommend the movie. It has a great story line and lots of action. This movie game a whole new perspective look on life. This movie is the best movie i have seen in a long long time. Titanic is a wonderful movie that makes you fall in love with the characters

Author: maura-miller
Review: If you have ever considered Gone With The Wind to be less than a masterpiece, you'll have to admit that this one is no less either! Titanic is one of the greatest American classics ever made. It tells the story of love and hope. The two lovers both think the world is there for them and classes cannot influence their deep love for eachtother.

Author: sxxxx
Review: This movie was a good movie period. Nobody can say different, but the thing that brought down the movie a little was the fact that rose and jack where the movie focused the most. They were fake. Lets be realistic nobody is going to fall in love with someone in two days. Had they been a couple together already before they got on titanic that would have been good. Characters Like the legendary Captain Smith, Mr Andrews, Murdoch, wilde, Lightholler, And Ismay. They were in the movie but could have been more involved. The sinking was sad. Captain smiths scene where he heads to the bridge and when all the windows burst when its completely submerged is probably one of the best scenes in movie history.

Author: capripak
Review_Title: the only greatest movie i had ever watched.
Review: its now 1 a.m.and before going to sleep .i need to salute this movie as its unfair not say a single word for this movie before going to sleep,i re watched it after a long time and after went to my bed, ,i looked intently at the roof for about half and hour and could not believe that those people on ship were gone through all this.and all the unimaginable LOVE fr kate and jack even though this was a fiction movie and some of the facts might be different ,but this movie produced by a human,James is extra xtra ordinary,i give damn to all faults in the movie pointed by ur any of the viewer .in spite of all those faults,which were noticed and calculated by the viewers after their sheer hard work,to say something against this movie as its part of their nature to be critic ALWAYS an ordinary viewer won,t mind them come on,the movie is fr us to enjoy,to feel the pain,and to understand all the agonies ,no one is perfect,

Review_Title: Titanic is UNDENIABLY AWFUL, completely AWFUL indeed!
Review: Okay, I really don't understand what teenage girls see in this awful movie anyway.

Author: Farsong
Review_Title: Two starcrossed lovers caught in a tragic historic event.
Review: Is there anyone who hasn't seen this movie yet?  If so, I recommend finding a bargain theater still showing it.  I feel this movie will lose a lot in the translation to the small screen.

Author: SpinoC66
Review: so in 1997, my parents went to the theatres ajd saw Titanic and when they came home my mom was all in tears and my dad was laughing. Of course he was laughing because of all the people frozen. Now i was only 6 years old and i wanted to see the movie really bad, but my parents were like "no it is not a movie for you of your age"

Author: layla_ramirez
Review_Title: Love Leonardo in the movie with Kate!!!
Review: They look excellent in the movie together...... They would also make a cute couple. I love the movie titanic and of all the special effects. It's a love story with true facts of the titanic. It's my number one movie of all times. But Jack shouldn't have died in the movie. GREAT JOB! Even if this was a true story.....it would have had so many more viewers if Jack and rose died together...old or young......It was all put great together and an excellent touch to it that can make you cry for several hours. I also love how all the ladies wear their gowns like they would have in the early 1900's.......But what makes the movie even more of a love story and a sad story is when rose dies in her warm bed like an old lady like she promised. and she dies having a dream of her getting married with Jack Dawson.

Author: perulv
Review: When I saw this movie, I thought it was great. It was the movie of my dreams, I've always wanted to see what "Titanic" looked like below deck while it sunk. Mr. Cameron and his crew has done a great job with the special effects.

Author: ylan25
Review_Title: Good job on a bad script
Review: Nice movie, superb directing, excellent effects, good enough acting(Kate was OK, Leo is the best actor among those least talented beautiful people). An empty script specially designed to show off its special effects. That sums up the most overrated film in history. I will resist commenting on the overplayed soundtrack.

Author: dawn_edworthy
Review_Title: Titanic a wonderful movie tearful and heart stopping
Review: This film is an excellent film and a very good costume drama i absolutely loved this film from beginning to end Kate and leo i think are fantastic actor and played the part very well unfortunately with tragic consequences it made me cry at the end and made people think about the class differences and those poor people who died on that ship. Titanic a wonderful movie tearful and heart stopping. One of the best scenes is when jack and rose go dancing to Irish music and rose gets tipsy when she balance's on her toes i thought that must of hert her feet. this film get 10 out of 10 from me a must see movie i would recommend it to anyone.

Author: Andy-241
Review_Title: The most powerful movie of this time.
Review: When I say this is the most powerful movie of this time, I understand that there are not a lot of brilliant movies to see. When I first went to see "Titanic" , and I saw those introducing images, and heard that unforgottable melody, I asked myself: "What is Cameron going to tell me?". And three hours later I understood that maybe this is the best movie I've ever seen. DiCaprio and Winslet make it bigger. They could reach the audience heart and soul. I am not sure if this makes Cameron to be a genius or an excellent director. I really don't know it yet. But I am sure that he made me get into this ship, and live a beautiful love story beside Rose and Jack.

Author: John-295
Review_Title: For $200m, they should've hired an editor.
Review: I might've enjoyed the movie a little more had they tightened it up a little bit.  3 hours 20 minutes is an awful long time for such a shallow plot.

Author: xbittersweeto5
Review: I'm a thirteen year old girl and when I saw this movie about three weeks ago I fell in love with it, its now one of my favorites. I've seen it 5 times since and think it is a great movie to just watch on those sad rainy days.Its a real tear jerker when I saw it I cried the whole ending.. about 45 minutes of the movie. Its long but when your watching it your just so into the movie you don't realize how long its really been. Me and all my friends love this movie and even a couple of my guy friends love the movie too. Its a great movie for anyone to watch. My little sister who is three watched it with me and loved it too. This movie was based on something that really happened with sometime that could of and that really makes it more interesting to watch because of the fact this might of been how two lovers lives were changed and the ending is a perfect way to finish the story. This was the cutest movie I've seen.

Author: aleipho
Review: The movie had absolutely nothing to do with the Titanic. It was a love story. The Titanic was simply a backdrop for the theme. I was sorely disappointed. To me it was disrespectful of the people who lost their lives on that ship.

Author: zz-3
Review_Title: Great movie but I've seen better.
Review: Epic adventure film. The story of the Titanic tragedy might have been told in a better way ( A Night to Remember ) but it has never been and never will be told in a bigger way. A huge amount of money was spent and unlike some other films ( Waterworld ) it showed. Leonardo and Kathy Bates are excellent while the others give pretty good performances. The climax is probably the best in Hollywood history and the sets are also fantastic. Having said that , the movie is certainly not the best of all times and I doubt that it deserved the 11 Oscars. Kate certainly didn't deserve to be nominated. The movie swept away the whole world and probably the academy members also got a little carried away. It definitely is worth watching at least twice.

Author: prizm
Review: Titanic was not a great movie, however, I found it very entertaining. There were many memorable scenes, some interesting special effects, reasonable adherence to the facts about the sinking, respect for those that perished, and a lovely leading lady.  Hey, it was just a movie.  Wait for it to show at the dollar movie house, and you'll get your money's worth. I wish there were more movies like Titanic.  I would start going to the movies frequently again. Watching the movie has motivated me to read Lord's book and see the movie by the same name.

Author: Katefan411
Review_Title: A movie that will never sink with history
Review: Titanic is a great love story set in the hands of a historical background, with a phenomenal plot, Titanic is one of the greatest stories ever. Where survivor Rose, is narrating the story she experienced herself, back to her seventeen engaged self to the heir of steel tycoon Nathan Hockley, his son Caledon. Rose feels trapped, but on her stay on Titanic finds Jack Dawson by fate, who she shares a personal and special connection with. The dreams he is already living she aspires, and there fore an amazing chemistry is formed between the two. Until an iceberg hits, and their love for each other is tested, by powerful means. Its a race for survival, and the passengers are doomed. With an amazing cast, this tale comes to life on the big screen, and will always be remembered.

Author: aclarsen
Review: Tried watching this movie four times.

Author: nicholas_ritrovato
Review: The Hope Diamond is in the Smithsonian.

Author: chancely40
Review: Well done.  I consider this a perfect film.  Finally a film that effectively gives something to everyone.  A romance film for the romantics;a horror film for fright fans;a disaster film;a great effects film for science fiction fans;and an action film with an independent film feel made for all demographics.

Author: JetMax3
Review: Almost a century ago, the magnificent ship cristened the Titanic sailed the ocean waters. It was the grandest ship of them all, and its luxury was unsurpassed at the time. But little did anyone know that its first voyage would also be its last and would come to be known as the grandest ship wreck of all time.

Author: moop96
Review: I really did not want to see another version of the "Titanic" story on film, because there already were two superb versions, both made in the fifties. I went anyway, as this one was hard to avoid, you might say. I found the story on the ship quite annoying, tailored with shallowness, and aimed smack-dab at the Blockbuster potential: Teenagers.

Author: chris776
Review_Title: Dear Jim Cameron-how could you approve of this transfer?
Review: I just spot checked your new 3-disc release of TITANIC.

Author: shanesmw
Review_Title: I Can't Stop Watching This Film
Review: When I first saw Titanic I was nine years old and just wanted to see the movie that all the critics were buzzing about. I had no real idea of what the true story of the movie would be; I merely assumed it was an action movie and that the CGI was amazing. Well it was filled with action and the CGI was amazing but what amazed me further was the story itself. I've seen Titanic in full probably about 10-15 times and most of them are recent viewings. I don't know exactly why I cannot stop watching this film but I do realize now more than ever why it is such a great film. There are flaws of course but give Cameron a break, he pulled off a film not many directors would've even dared to attempt.

Author: wandijoe75
Review: It's a pretty good movie all around. The story line is interesting and draws you in and make you think. I love all the music and the actors as well. The movie is just a little too long but still one of the best movies of all time. 20 years from now it will still be worth seeing and still a tear jerker. No one should miss seeing this movie. It makes you want to know more about the Titanic and what happen all those years ago. It's a lesson teacher in so many ways not just a love story. If you miss it then you have missed a Winner.I can't see why anyone wouldn't want to see this movie. It's far from boring. Just imagine that's you or your love one on that ship and what would you do? Would you be able to handle it? As I stated the only downer was the time it was a little too long for my liking.

Author: realitybites87
Review_Title: "Titanic" is a misunderstood movie that needs to be appreciated.
Review: Titanic is an epic, a true epic, and will continue to be loved forever. Many people did not like it because they do not understand the message epics are sending out: "Morals put to life, dreams fulfilled in movies."  Titanic fulfilled these and will continue to for generations.  "Gone With the Wind" was respected just as much as Titanic when it came out, and now many deem it to be the best movie the world has ever seen.  So go back and watch "Titanic" and remember the words I said as you view this epic spectacle masterpiece that has been made immortal by being named the title of "Best Picture 1997" and "The No. 1 Movie in the World".

Author: cristalacatus
Review: A rich girl, good family, Rose (Kate Winslet) engaged to Cal Hockley (Billy Zane), falls in love with a poor boy Jack Dawson (Leonardo DiCaprio) and live an adventure few days more intense than living some people in a life. ADVENTURE, LOVE, EMOTION, HISTORY are just a few words that can synthesize exceptional cinematic transposition of a real event that has forever marked the history of the xx century. Although I watched the movie more than 10 times, every time I was enchanted for the first time. Is one of the most loved stories, and since the time when I look at it I leave a conclusion that is, the moment must be lived, just like the two lovers who live your love story in front of all the obstacles I encounter all without regrets. They also feel the intensity of life and slowly build their own world on a wonderful boat which eventually this carefree world of those missed lovers would turn into a painful reality, a real disaster.

Author: vanshikaagarwal-73510
Review: The film is a real-life tragic drama,enacted more than one thousand and fifty years ago,on the luxurious and invincible ship "Titanic",that struck an iceberg. It sank in the Pacific Ocean,with more than one thousand and five hundred passengers on board. The director ingeniously weaves a love story against the backdrop of this tragedy. It is the story of a poor girl 'Rose' ,who falls in love with a young boy 'Jack' , immigrating to American for work. Rose's mother,an ambitious woman wants her to marry a wealthy young man, traveling abroad the ship. The drama has the usual twists and turns ,with the wealthy man accusing Jack of stealing a diamond necklace" The heart of the ocean".

Author: mrprovolone
Review: I really stayed away from this movie when it came out but I just saw it for the first time the other day and it is really really good, the thing about this movie is, its not just the story of a big ship that sinks but is more about the lifestyles of the rich and the famous back in that time period and also a love story tied in there, The Ship is just in the background while the people on board are the real story. I really like DiCaprio's Character full of spirit and energy good attitude towards life he's a great Actor and James Cameron is a fine Director I do give this movie a 5 out of 5 great story and very entertaining you should watch this movie if you' never seen it before any one who likes a great movie will like this one

Author: xxact
Review: Well, I have to say that I was only 5yrs old when this movie came out and I saw it in theaters when it did. I fell in love with it that same day. I wasn't sure I understood the entire story, but something at the age of 5 sparked my imagination and it was just wonderful. I think this movie has a great mix of such wonderful actors and a great director. Everything about this movie was wonderful. I have to say this will always be my favorite movie. And it was because of Kate Winslet that sparked my imagination and I've wanted to be an actress. So i owe her a great deal of thanks even though I have never met her, but would Love to meet her. This movie was certainly one for the ages. And I think they showed a lot of emotion and it just left me in awe. I hope you all feel the same way.

Author: DrCerla
Review: As a doctor I quickly realized that the role character Rosemary (Kate Winslet) simply represented a mentally unstable personality disorder. Borderline, histrionic, you decide. As such I can not find it appropriate to romanticize such characteristics. Thus, glorifying mental illness. Also, the male counterpart played by Leonardo DiCaprio is very shallow, and with unimpressive efforts is given too much space in this movie. Somewhat of an anti-hero, got lucky to meet the personality just mentioned. I guess another way to say it is that she did all the work for him in double sense this time. Beneficial is the special effects and all the work on the set. In fact this is the main reason for seeing this movie. Of course the connection to the spectacular historical event is another reason to see it. Kate Winslet despite above mentioned deficiency in the character is a beautiful face and well acted, so for that reason it may as well be worthwhile.

Author: lukapapp
Review: Beautiful movie. Touching story, great music, great acting from Leo and Kate. It could be little bit shorter.

Author: jerick_4
Review_Title: one of the best drama movie i've seen
Review: Well! this film catched the hearts of million viewers all over the world. By the way, this film was released early in 1997, but i've watched this film late on 2000. What a late bloomer. Some people say's this is a great and very touching movies. So I tried to search a original copy of this film and luckily i found it. It's very touching you know. The story lines, sound effect and flow of the story. I've feel I was there in the unsinkable ship together with the other passenger when its sinking. What a masterfully done by James Cameron.

Author: anzlkd
Review: Titanic is an enjoyable film, which can make you cry. It is based on a real story about a liner which got into difficulties in the ocean. The film stars Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet.

Author: johncopetas
Review: A good movie, but whoever made up this story did not try to make it the least bit believable. Who would actually believe that "the worlds biggest ship" would sink because it hit an iceberg, it's just not realistic. And the name "Titanic" what does that even mean, what idiot thought it was a fitting name for a giant fictional ship. All around just a bad movie and too long.

Author: q-50062
Review: There is no substitute for the classic movie in my mind, love is magic.I will always sigh for love.

Author: tommycolorado
Review: Although Titanic is a documentary, the embelished love story was all too predictable.  Kate Winslett did not win me over, nor did Leonardo. Different stars and a better 'hidden' story would have made this a great movie.  Special effects were impressive.

Author: sataint
Review: The movie is nice, fantastic dvd. This is hell of movie, but some of the mistakes.

Author: smith44
Review_Title: Greatest Film of The Twentieth Century, Ode To Titanic
Review: Greatest Film of The Twentieth Century Titanic is without a doubt the most moving and artist film of my lifetime. Titanic closes off the end of the century with an ode to the age. A disaster to end all disasters, a love story to last all the ages and a film that will be better appreciated for its perfection in decades to come. The movie that has achieved the most Oscar nominations (14, and All About Eve) and has won the most Oscars (only rivaled to Ben-Hur and The Lord Of The Rings in Oscars). The most popular film all-time in Box Office terms, and the most Expensive film ever made. Testimate to its glory.

Author: Movie_Finder
Review: I have heard many negative comments about this movie. "the acting was terrible" or "the movie lacks suspense." While the movie is considerably long and may seem boring to some, there is no denying that "Titanic" is a masterpiece. The acting is very decent and those who claim that Leonardo DiCaprio or Kate Winslet "can't act" must have some sort of personal vendetta against them because they do a very convincing job in the movie; especially in their very precious scenes together.

Author: koed-05319
Review: By far the best movie of all time. Titanic has everything you need, Love, Drama, Action, Suspense and etc. You already know what's gonna happen but the great thing about titanic is how James Cameron placed was able to place a Romeo and Juliet story inside the ship and keep you on the edge of your seat as the story progresses. There is a reason why Titanic won 11 Oscars from the history of the ship to the amazing acting of the chosen cast and choice of music presented on screen. Titanic in my eyes is the greatest romance film ever made.

Author: megoofy
Review: I loved the movie when I saw it. Mainly I like the movie because of Leonardo DiCaprio, he's such a great actor. I've seen all of his movies including The Departed which I just saw today in theaters. Titanic is probably the only really romantic movie that I am willing to watch again and again, alone or with someone else. When they say that the Titanic kiss was the most famous, they weren't kidding. Man I'd LOVE to have someone kiss ME like that on the bow of a famous ship the day the ship was supposed to sink. That personally is just really romantic that even though they are both doomed (one to death, and one to lose the love of her life) they still share that passionate moment for a few seconds on the ship, very romantic...:)

Author: pizzalover10489
Review: *May include spoilers

Author: dass_andre
Review:
I don't know how many times I have seen titanic, but every time I got the same enthusiasm for the characters and story of the movie.
This is by no doubt, the best movie I have ever seen, and that's simply because it has everything you want in a movie.

Author: armaansolanki
Review:
There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.
Love is the whole thing, we are only pieces.
